snippet: Officials in Chhattisgarh State issued an urgent warning to practitioners to cease distribution of the antibiotic ciprofloxacin after at least 15 deaths were linked to contaminated pills.
abstract: Senior official in Indian state of Chhattisgarh says antibioitic pills contaminated with rat poison may have been cause of at least 15 deaths of women following sterilization surgery; police arrest officials at Mahawar Pharma, small company supplying medicines to state government.

byline.original: By SUHASINI RAJ and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Bokaghat, India.

lead_paragraph: Officials in Chhattisgarh State issued an urgent warning to practitioners to cease distribution of the antibiotic ciprofloxacin after at least 15 deaths were linked to contaminated pills.

headline.main: Indian State Recalls Pills Linked to Sterilization Deaths
headline.print_headline: Indian State Recalls Pills Linked to Sterilization Deaths
